data.text:
Now is the time to reimagine your future with our new WDH housing / office-based apprenticeships.

Are you looking to learn and develop skills for life? An apprenticeship with WDH is a chance to start your career journey, or even take the opportunity to re-train in a growing, vibrant housing sector.

Who we are

WDH is a social housing landlord delivering high quality, affordable homes in the Wakefield district and beyond.

WDH has over 31,000 properties but is much more than bricks and mortar. With a commitment to make real change through social outcomes, it helps customers to tackle the challenges of modern living and through partnership works to create confident and sustainable communities.

With a workforce of over 1,400 people, WDH has held Investors in People accreditation since 2010.

We are an inclusive workforce and an equal opportunities employer committed to diversity and progression at work.

For more information, visit: www.wdh.co.uk

What you'll be doing

Becoming an apprentice is an important decision and it involves making a commitment. It takes time to learn new skills, but the Apprentice Team Leader, service areas and mentors will be on hand to supervise and train you. There are opportunities available across multiple service areas at WDH.

You will be working alongside passionate and experienced colleagues in a busy, inclusive environment and gain the necessary knowledge, skills and behaviours to become a vital member of the team.

This year we have 8 new opportunities in the following areas:

Housing and Property Management Level 3 Apprenticeships within the following teams:

Technical Services - within the Repairs & Maintenance, Specialist Services and Construction Projects teams;

Care and Health Team;

Debt Team;

Estates Team; and

Cash Wise Team.

What training do you get?

As part of our apprenticeship programme, you will receive up to 2 years of training and gain a nationally recognised Level 3 qualification as detailed above. You will need to commit to completing all coursework and assessments as part of your apprenticeship qualification. Dependant on your successfully completing the apprenticeship standard you will then have the opportunity to become a ‘Business Trainee’ for up to 12 months which will give you time to look for a permanent role within WDH. Our apprenticeship programme also offers further opportunities of personal and professional development and an insight into wider business operations.

You will receive mentorship and support in learning your role and the procedures within the service area.

You will have the opportunity to attend internal and external meetings including helping develop links and partnerships with external agencies.

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for individuals who are enthusiastic team players, good problem solvers who demonstrate a positive attitude and are committed to delivering excellent customer care. We are committed to creating a diverse workforce and encourage all ethnic backgrounds and ages to apply.

Applicants will have achieved, or be predicted to achieve, five GCSE’s or equivalent (grade 9 - 4/A*- C) including Maths and English language.

If you would like more information about our apprenticeships, email your contact details to apprentice@wdh.co.uk

To hear more about our apprenticeships and useful resources, visit our website: www.wdh.co.uk/Apprenticeships

How to apply

Read the job description and person specification.

Complete the office apprentice application form ensuring all sections are filled out.

Email your office apprentice application form to recruitment@wdh.co.uk before the closing date. Applications close at midnight on the date specified at the top of this page.

Please note: we do not accept CVs for this position, you must complete the apprenticeship application form to be able to be shortlisted. If you are successful in securing an interview you will be required to provide colour copies of your qualification certificates or predicted grades by a set deadline.

The role will start in October 2024.
